subtitle: For a deliciously different buffet dish try this alternative to a pate, which is not only colourful but incredibly tasty too.

method.text: Place a sheet of cling film on a flat surface. Arrange the ham on the cling film, to form a rectangle.
With a palette knife spread the ham with 1 cm thick of goat's cheese. Season with freshly ground black pepper.
Strain and dry the blanched spinach. Liquidise into a puree. Add the nutmeg. Season to taste. With a palette knife carefully spread over the cheese.
Starting from the edge nearest to you, roll the mixture up to create a Catherine wheel effect.
Cut into slices with a slightly warmed knife. Serve well chilled.

title: Ham, spinach and goats cheese roulade
